result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Lumar Gavin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All costs, fees and surcharges imposed.  If defendant fails to pay all costs, surcharges before the end of the senence, a civil judgment shall be entered.
If defendant is eligible, he may participate in the Drug Treatment program.

superMiscConds.notes: Follow all rules of Extended Supervision.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted  felon he may never possess a firearm or any body armor; and that he  cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Lumar Gavin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (22 pages) commencing 08-06-2015 PLEA & SENTENCING received and filed.

Defendant Eric Lumar Gavin in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Eric Lumar Gavin in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are in court for a plea and sentencing.
As to count 1
  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he/she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was/not ordered. 
Sentencing continued....
  Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence report reviewed. Statements made as to sentencing.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, with credit for 103 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2   YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  If the defendant is eligible, he may participate in the drug treatment program.

The Court imposed the following conditions of extended supervision:  

- Follow all rules of extended supervision
- Court ordered all costs, fees and surcharges IMPOSED. If the defendant fails to pay all cost, surcharges before the end of the sentence, a civil judgement shall be entered. 

Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon that he may never possess a firearm or any body armor.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Eric Lumar Gavin not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Court granted defense request. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned to branch 36.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Eric Lumar Gavin not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced.  State filed and Amended Criminal Complaint (charges remain the same), copy provided to defense counsel who waived reading. An information has already been filed in this matter, an initial appearance on the amended criminal complaint is not required. Amended Criminal Complaint clarifies relationship between the defendant and the victim in this matter. Defense counsel requests case be set for a Status Conference.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Status conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric Lumar Gavin in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Eric Lumar Gavin in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Case transfered to Branch 23 due to ADA assignment per Chief Judge directive.  Discussion regarding DA assignment of this case to DV.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Defense counsel requests case be set over for a Status Conference in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Eric Lumar Gavin in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Eric Lumar Gavin in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
